001package org.relationlearn.util;
002
003import com.aliasi.tokenizer.RegExTokenizerFactory;
004import com.aliasi.tokenizer.TokenizerFactory;
005import java.util.regex.Pattern;
006
007/**
008 * Utility class used to manipulate text in order to aid any TextFilter
009 * implementation in its job if needed.
010 * 
011 * @see org.relationlearn.filters.TextFilter
012 */
013public class TextUtils {
014    
015    /**
016     * Pattern compiled with the regex "\w+".
017     */
018    public static final Pattern WORDS_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\w+");
019    
020    private static final TokenizerFactory TOKENIZER;
021    
022    static {
023        TOKENIZER = new RegExTokenizerFactory(WORDS_PATTERN);
024    }
025    
026    private TextUtils() {}
027    
028    /**
029     * Splits a unique String containing a text into and array of Strings
030     * that contain words, using the Java regex {@code \w+}.
031     * 
032     * @param text the original text to split
033     * @return the input text splitted in an more easy to manipulate way for
034     * TextFilter implementations
035     * 
036     * @see org.relationlearn.filters.TextFilter
037     */
038    public static String[] getWordsFromText(String text) {
039        return getTokensFromTextUsingFactory(text, TOKENIZER);
040    }
041    
042    /**
043     * Splits a unique String into tokens using the Pattern provided by 
044     * {@code p}.
045     * 
046     * @param text the original text to tokenize
047     * @param p the Patter to use for tokenization
048     * @return the input text splitted in tokens using {@code p}
049     * 
050     * @see Pattern
051     */
052    public static String[] getTokensFromTextUsingRegex(String text, Pattern p) {
053        TokenizerFactory tf = new RegExTokenizerFactory(p);
054        return getTokensFromTextUsingFactory(text, tf);
055    }
056    
057    /**
058     * Splits a unique String into tokens using the TokenizerFactory
059     * {@code factory}.
060     * 
061     * @param text the original text to tokenize
062     * @param factory the TokenizerFactory to use for tokenization
063     * @return the input text tokenized using the TokenizerFactory 
064     * {@code factory}
065     * 
066     * @see com.aliasi.tokenizer.TokenizerFactory
067     */
068    public static String[] getTokensFromTextUsingFactory(String text,
069            TokenizerFactory factory) {
070        char[] ch = text.toCharArray();
071        return factory.tokenizer(ch, 0, ch.length).tokenize();
072    }
073
074}
